diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Severe Mitral Stenosis Secondary to Hunter's Syndrome (Mucopolysaccharidosis Type II)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Echocardiographic findings indicated a thickened mitral valve with severe mitral stenosis. Histopathologic examination confirmed that the cause of mitral stenosis was due to the infiltration of polysaccharides from Hunter's syndrome, differentiating it from rheumatic causes.
